block.p: Julia Hsin-Ya Chou, the daughter of Dr. Dorothy Chou and Dr. Ting-Chao Chou of Paramus, N.J., was married Friday to Ricardo S. Martinez, the son of Bertha and Ricardo Martinez of Los Angeles. The Rev. Giles Spoonhour, a member of the Federation of Christian Ministries, performed the ceremony at the Water's Edge, a restaurant in Long Island City, Queens.
The bride and the bridegroom, both 27, graduated from Harvard University, she cum laude and he magna cum laude.

Julia Hsin-Ya Chou, the daughter of Dr. Dorothy Chou and Dr. Ting-Chao Chou of Paramus, N.J., was married Friday to Ricardo S. Martinez, the son of Bertha and Ricardo Martinez of Los Angeles. The Rev. Giles Spoonhour, a member of the Federation of Christian Ministries, performed the ceremony at the Water's Edge, a restaurant in Long Island City, Queens.
The bride and the bridegroom, both 27, graduated from Harvard University, she cum laude and he magna cum laude.

Ms. Chou, who is keeping her name, received an M.B.A. last month from the University of Pennsylvania. She is to begin as a marketing manager in the merchant division of the American Express Company in New York in September. Her father directs the biochemical pharmacology laboratory and the department of preclinical pharmacology at Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center in New York. Her mother retired as a principal scientist at Kraft Foods, in Tarrytown, N.Y.

Mr. Martinez is an associate at Simpson Thacher & Bartlett, the New York law firm. He received a law degree from Columbia University. His mother retired as a bookkeeper at the Community Ambulatory Care Center in Los Angeles. His father is a teaching assistant for Spanish and speech classes at East Los Angeles College.
